characters.name: Maria
characters.description: the bride. Naïve, excitable, impulsive, and strong willed. To summarise: a handful. Some intimacy involved.

characters.name: Anneli
characters.description: Maria’s maid of honour. A very tired realist, trying to steer a very excited and then very stressed bride. Some intimacy involved.

characters.name: Terri
characters.description: Laura’s current partner. Eerily unphased by the chaos of the day. Some optional intimacy involved.

characters.name: Laura
characters.description: Maria’s mum (and Grandma Pat’s daughter). A cool mum, but sometimes blunt and self-centred. Some optional intimacy involved.

characters.name: Janine
characters.description: Callum’s mum (and Cillian’s ex-wife). A little shallow but means well.

characters.name: Grandma Pat
characters.description: Maria’s grandmother. An extremely patient woman with an open mind and dry wit.

characters.name: Stacey
characters.description: a waitress. Quiet, but smart. Hates her job.

characters.name: Darren
characters.description: Callum’s younger brother. A classic awkward teenager; antisocial and hates everything and everyone, other than Maria.

characters.name: Callum
characters.description: the groom. A hopeless romantic but emotionally immature. A nerd at heart. Some intimacy involved.

characters.name: Richard
characters.description: Callum’s best man. A Golden Retriever of a man; genuinely a good guy. Some intimacy involved.

characters.name: Christopher
characters.description: Maria’s uncle (and Grandma Pat’s son). Unashamedly camp and proudly gay. A throwback to a classic lovie and doing absolutely nothing to hide it.

characters.name: Cillian
characters.description: Callum’s dad. Grumpy, petty and quite bitter as a person.

characters.name: Carol
characters.description: the celebrant. Believes wholeheartedly in what they do.

footnotes: The auditions are open to anyone. This is a story about family, and families come in different shapes and can look wildly different; from varied age gaps between generations, through to adoption. I do not need cast members to share any kind of family resemblance.

Please also note that part of the play explores LGBTQ+ themes, and the rehearsal room will be a safe space for members of that community. If this doesn’t align with your personal outlook, please consider whether this is the right production for you.

Rehearsals will be Tuesday and Thursday and then Sundays, with the final week having a fourth, as we build up to opening night. Rehearsals will start the very last week of Dec. I will try and build a rehearsal schedule that doesn’t require everyone at every rehearsal, but I do expect good availability from everyone.
